org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry

Enum PolygonGridShift

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PolygonGridShift>
      • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.PolygonGridShift
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<PolygonGridShift>

    public enum PolygonGridShift
extends java.lang.Enum<PolygonGridShift>
    Specifies the shifting of rows or columns in a PolygonGrid. Valid choices dependon on the underlying RegularPolygon. Specifies how even-numbered rows or columns are shifted, relative to odd-numbered ones. For this purpose, counting starts at one for the PolygonGrid row or column at index position zero, so the first row or column is considered odd-numbered.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      COLUMN_DOWN
      Specifies that even-numbered columns are shifted downward.
      COLUMN_UP
      Specifies that even-numbered columns are shifted upward.
      NONE
      Specifies that no rows or columns are shifted.
      ROW_LEFT
      Specifies that even-numbered rows are shifted left.
      ROW_RIGHT
      Specifies that even-numbered rows are shifted right.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final PolygonGridShift NONE
        Specifies that no rows or columns are shifted. NONE is the only valid choice for a square grid with PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE orientation.

      • COLUMN_UP

        public static final PolygonGridShift COLUMN_UP
        Specifies that even-numbered columns are shifted upward. COLUMN_UP and COLUMN_DOWN are the only valid choices for a hexagon grid with PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE orientation.

      • COLUMN_DOWN

        public static final PolygonGridShift COLUMN_DOWN
        Specifies that even-numbered columns are shifted downward. COLUMN_UP and COLUMN_DOWN are the only valid choices for a hexagon grid with PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE orientation.

      • ROW_RIGHT

        public static final PolygonGridShift ROW_RIGHT
        Specifies that even-numbered rows are shifted right. ROW_RIGHT and ROW_LEFT are the only valid choices for a hexagon grid with PolygonOrientation.ON_VERTEX orientation.

      • ROW_LEFT

        public static final PolygonGridShift ROW_LEFT
        Specifies that even-numbered rows are shifted left. ROW_RIGHT and ROW_LEFT are the only valid choices for a hexagon grid with PolygonOrientation.ON_VERTEX orientation.

      • anyColumns

        public boolean anyColumns()
        Indicates whether the PolygonGridShift shifts any columns.
        Returns:
        true for COLUMN_UP or COLUMN_DOWN, else false

      • anyRows

        public boolean anyRows()
        Indicates whether the PolygonGridShift shifts any rows.
        Returns:
        true for ROW_LEFT or ROW_RIGHT, else false

      • isDownColumn

        public boolean isDownColumn(int column)
        Determines whether the specified column is shifted down compared to its neighbors. Always returns false if anyColumns() is false.
        Parameters:
        column - the zero-based index of the column to test
        Returns:
        true if column is shifted down, else false

      • isLeftRow

        public boolean isLeftRow(int row)
        Determines whether the specified row is shifted left compared to its neighbors. Always returns false if anyRows() is false.
        Parameters:
        row - the zero-based index of the row to test
        Returns:
        true if row is shifted left, else false

      • isRightRow

        public boolean isRightRow(int row)
        Determines whether the specified row is shifted right compared to its neighbors. Always returns false if anyRows() is false.
        Parameters:
        row - the zero-based index of the row to test
        Returns:
        true if row is shifted right, else false

      • isUpColumn

        public boolean isUpColumn(int column)
        Determines whether the specified column is shifted up compared to its neighbors. Always returns false if anyColumns() is false.
        Parameters:
        column - the zero-based index of the column to test
        Returns:
        true if column is shifted up, else false
